useCase.name: Opening TaRGeT
useCase.description: It describes how the TaRGeT should behave when it is started up.

flow.description: Start up the TaRGeT with .NET and Java runtime environment installed.

step.action: Start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: The .NET and Java runtime environment are installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java and .NET versions) [ER_TARGET_0020, ER_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A splash screen is displayed. Verify the requirements document to check the splash screen. [FR_TARGET_0220]

step.action: Wait some seconds.
step.response: The TaRGeT is started. No TaRGeT project is opened. A background image is displayed (see requirements document for more details). [FR_TARGET_0225]

flow.description: Start up the TaRGeT when .NET runtime environment is not installed in the machine.

step.action: Try to start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: Java runtime environment is installed in the machine. The .NET runtime environment is not installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java and .NET versions). [ER_TARGET_0020, ER_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed informing that an error has occurred and asking the user to see the log file. [FR_TARGET_0230]

flow.description: Start up the TaRGeT when Java runtime environment is not installed in the machine.

step.action: Try to start the TaRGeT.
step.condition: The Java runtime environment is not installed in the machine (see requirements for further information about Java version). [ER_TARGET_0020]
step.response: A message is displayed informing that no JRE is installed. The TaRGeT is not started up. [FR_TARGET_0230]

useCase.name: Creating a Project from Blank Work Area
useCase.description: Create a TaRGeT project.

flow.description: Create a new project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. No project is opened.
step.response: The “New Project” option is enabled in the drop down menu. The Close Project option is disabled.

step.action: Select the “New Project” option. [FR_TARGET_0020]
step.response: The “New Project” screen is displayed. The default project name is displayed in the “Project Name” field. The default project location is displayed in the “Destination Folder” field.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed. A new project work area is displayed. The project folder is created in the specified location. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0010]

flow.description: Type a valid project name.

step.action: Type a valid project name.
step.response: The “Project Name” field is filled. [FR_TARGET_0025]

flow.description: Cancel the project creation.

step.action: Click on the “Cancel” button.
step.response: The tool goes back to the window it was before the project creation.

flow.description: Browse destination folder.

step.action: Browse and select the location in which the project shall be created.
step.response: The “Destination Folder” field is filled.

flow.description: Create the project using shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+N.
step.response: The “New Project” screen is displayed. The default project name is displayed in the “Project Name” field. The default project location is displayed in the “Destination Folder” field. [FR_TARGET_0020]

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed. A new project work area is displayed. The project folder is created in the specified location. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0010]

flow.description: Type an invalid project name.

step.action: Type an invalid project name (e.g. with one of the following characters “:\/<>?*).
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that some characters are not allowed. The “Finish” button is disabled. [FR_TARGET_0025]

flow.description: No project name is typed.

step.action: Type a blank project name. [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that a name must be specified. The “Finish” button is disabled.

flow.description: Project directory already exists.

step.action: Type a valid project name. [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: The “Project Name” field is filled.

step.action: Browse and select the location in which there is a directory with the same name of the project.
step.response: The “Destination Folder” field is filled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A dialog is displayed indicating that the project folder already exists. The dialog asks if the user you want to proceed and erase all content of the folder. [FR_TARGET_0020]

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: All the folder contents is deleted and the new project is created.

flow.description: Do not delete all folder contents.

step.action: Click on “No” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the “New Project” window.

useCase.name: Creating a Project from an Already Opened Project
useCase.description: A project is already opened.

flow.description: A project is already opened.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “New Project” option is enabled in the drop down menu.

step.action: Select the “New Project” option. [FR_TARGET_0020]
step.response: A dialog box is displayed informing that the current project will be closed in order to create a new one.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The current project is closed. The “New Project” screen is displayed. The default project name is displayed in the “Project Name” field. The default project location is displayed in the “Destination Folder” field.

flow.description: Cancel the project creation.

step.action: Click on “No” button.
step.response: The popup is closed and the tool goes back to the main window with the previous project opened.

useCase.name: Closing a Project
useCase.description: Close a project.

flow.description: Close a project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up and a project is already opened.
step.response: The “Close Project” option is enabled.

step.action: Select the “Close Project” option. [FR_TARGET_0035]
step.response: A message is displayed asking if the user really wants to close the project.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The project is closed. The blank project area is displayed. The background image is shown. [FR_TARGET_0225]

flow.description: Cancel the project closing.

step.action: Click on “No” button.
step.response: The popup is closed and the tool goes back to the main window.

flow.description: Close a project using shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+W.
step.response: A message is displayed asking if the user really wants to close the project. [FR_TARGET_0035]

useCase.name: Opening an Existing Project from Blank Work Area
useCase.description: Open an existing project.

flow.description: Open an existing project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is already started up. No project is opened.
step.response: The “Open Project” option is enabled.

step.action: Select the “Open Project” option. [FR_TARGET_0040]
step.response: The “Open Project” window is displayed. No project is selected. The “Finish” button is disabled.

step.action: Browse and select an existing project.
step.response: The “Project Name” field is now filled. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the selected existing project is being opened. After, the existing project is opened. The project work area is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

flow.description: Cancel the project opening.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The tool goes to the blank work area. No project is opened. [FR_TARGET_0225]

flow.description: Open using shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+O.
step.response: The “Open Project” window is displayed. No project is selected. The “Finish” button is disabled. [FR_TARGET_0040]

useCase.name: Opening an Existing Project from an Already Opened Project
useCase.description: A project is already opened.

flow.description: Open an existing project from an already opened project.

step.action: Go to “File” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is already started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “Open Project” option is enabled.

step.action: Select the “Open Project” option. [FR_TARGET_0040]
step.response: A dialog box is displayed informing that the current project will be closed in order to open another one.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The “Open Project” screen is displayed.

flow.description: Cancel the project opening.

step.action: Click on “No” button.
step.response: The dialog box is closed and the current project work area is displayed.

useCase.name: Refreshing a Project
useCase.description: Refresh a project.

flow.description: Refresh a project.

step.action: Go to “Project” option in the menu bar.
step.response: A menu with two options shall appear: “Refresh Automatically” and “Refresh Project”. “Refresh Automatically” option is checked. [FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: “Refresh automatically” option disabled.

step.action: Click in “Refresh Automatically” option.
step.condition: TaRGeT is already started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: “Refresh Automatically” option is not checked.

step.action: Open an already imported Use Case Document with the Microsoft Word (outside the TaRGeT).
step.condition: There is at least one imported Use Case Document. [FR_TARGET_0100]
step.response: The document is opened in the default viewer outside the TaRGeT.

step.action: Modify any field in Use Case Document and save the document.
step.response: The document is modified.

step.action: Go back to TaRGeT work area.
step.response: The project is not refreshed.

step.action: Go to “Project” in the menu bar and select “Refresh project” option.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: “Refresh automatically” option enabled.

step.action: Go to “Project” in the menu bar and select “Refresh project” option.
step.response: The project is refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: Using the Refresh shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+R.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

useCase.name: Importing Valid Use Case Documents
useCase.description: Import Use Case Documents.

flow.description: Import Use Case Documents.

step.action: Go to “Artifacts” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up. A project is already opened.
step.response: The “Import Use Case Documents” option is enabled.

step.action: Select “Import Use Case Documents” option. [FR_TARGET_0100]
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is disabled.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid Use Case Document.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document(s) is (are) being processed and imported.[FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: The imported document(s) is (are) placed in a specific folder and displayed in the “Artifacts” View. The imported use cases are displayed in the “Use Cases” View. [FR_TARGET_0010, FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: Import another document.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse another valid Use Case Document. The document must not have duplicated feature ids, when compared with the already browsed document.
step.condition: Another document has to be inserted on the “Documents To Import” list.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

flow.description: Cancel the importing.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the project work area.

flow.description: Import through shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+I.
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is disabled.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Feature ID
useCase.description: Use Case Document has duplicated feature ID.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated feature ID.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a Use Case Document with duplicated feature ID. This means that the document contains at least two features with the same ID.
step.condition: There is no imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: An error dialog is displayed indicating the document that has duplicated feature id [FR_TARGET_0125]

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The selected document(s) will not be imported. The focus goes back to “Import Documents” window.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Use Case ID
useCase.description: Use Case Document has duplicated use case ID.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has duplicated use case ID.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a Use Case Document with duplicated use case ID. This means that the document contains a feature that has at least two use cases with the same ID.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: An error dialog is displayed indicating the document that has duplicated use case ID. [FR_TARGET_0125]

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The selected document(s) will not be imported. The focus goes back to “Import Documents” window.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Invalid Structure
useCase.description: Use Case Document has invalid structure.

flow.description: Imported Use Case Document has an invalid structure.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a Use Case Document with invalid structure.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: An error dialog is displayed indicating the document that has an error. [FR_TARGET_0125]

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The selected document(s) will not be imported. The focus goes back to “Import Documents” window.

flow.description: Import another document.

step.action: Click on “Add Document” button and browse another valid Use Case Document.
step.condition: Another document has to be imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

flow.description: Cancel the importing.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the project work area.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document with an Empty Mandatory Field
useCase.description: Use Case Document has an empty mandatory field.

flow.description: Selected Use Case Document has an empty mandatory field.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a Use Case Document with an empty mandatory field.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: An error dialog is displayed indicating that the document has an error in the xml structure. [FR_TARGET_0125]

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The selected document(s) will not be imported. The focus goes back to “Import Documents” window.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Invalid Step ID References
useCase.description: Use Case Document has invalid id references.

flow.description: The selected Use Case Document contains invalid id references.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a Use Case Document with invalid ID references.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: A warning message is displayed indicating that the document contains errors.

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The imported document is placed in the documents folder and is displayed in the “Artifacts” View. The imported use cases are displayed in the “Use Cases” View. A special icon indicates the use cases with invalid references. Also the error view displays details about invalid id references and/or duplicated ids. [FR_TARGET_0010, FR_TARGET_0120]

flow.description: Import another valid document.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse another valid Use Case Document.
step.condition: Another document has to be imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document With Duplicated Step IDs
useCase.description: Use Case Document has duplicated Step IDs.

flow.description: The selected Use Case Document contains duplicated Step Ids.

step.action: Select “Browser” button and browse a Use Case Document with duplicated step ids. The document contains at least two steps in a use case with the same ID.
step.condition: No document is imported.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: A warning message is displayed indicating that the document contains errors.

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The imported document is placed in the documents folder and is displayed in the “Artifacts” View. The imported use cases are displayed in the “Use Cases” View. A special icon indicates the use cases with invalid references. Also the error view displays details about invalid id references and/or duplicated ids. [FR_TARGET_0010, FR_TARGET_0120]

flow.description: Select another document (valid).

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse another valid Use Case Document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

useCase.name: Importing a Use Case Document with a Feature Already Imported.
useCase.description: The documents have at least one feature with same name and ID. Another Use Case Document is already imported.

flow.description: A Use Case Document is already imported. The Use Case Documents have at least one common feature with same ID and name.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid Use Case Document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID and name and the use cases IDs are different.
step.condition: There is at least one valid document imported in the project.
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document(s) is (are) being processed and imported. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: The imported document is placed in a specific folder and displayed in the “Artifacts” view. The imported use cases are displayed in the “Use Cases” view. The feature icon in the “Use Cases” view shows that the feature was merged. [FR_TARGET_0010, FR_TARGET_0100]

flow.description: A Use Case Document is already imported. The Use Case Documents have at least one common feature with same ID and different names.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid Use Case Document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID but different names and the use cases IDs are different.
step.condition: There is at least one valid document imported in the project.
step.response: The “Import Documents” window is displayed. The “Finish” button is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document(s) is (are) being processed and imported. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: The imported document is placed in a specific folder and displayed in the “Artifacts” View. The imported use cases are displayed in the “Use Cases” View. The feature icon in the “Use Cases” view shows that the feature was merged. A new warning is displayed in the “Error” view indicating that the features have same ID but different names. [FR_TARGET_0010, FR_TARGET_0100, FR_TARGET_0120]

flow.description: The document contains a feature with same ID of another feature that belongs to a previously imported document.

step.action: Select “Add Document” button and browse a valid Use Case Document. The document and the already imported document have at least one common feature with same ID. The features have at least one use case with same ID.
step.condition: There is at least one valid imported document.
step.response: The selected document path is inserted in the “Documents To Import” list.

step.action: Click on “Finish” button.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed indicating that the document is being processed. [FR_TARGET_0110]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: An error dialog is displayed indicating the document that has an error. [FR_TARGET_0125]

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The selected document(s) will not be imported. The focus goes back to “Import Documents” window.

useCase.name: Viewing Use Case Documents with Microsoft Word
useCase.description: Viewing Use Case Documents with Microsoft Word.

flow.description: Double-click on the document.

step.action: Double-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

useCase.name: Viewing Valid Use Case in HTML Format
useCase.description: Viewing Use Case Documents in HTML format.

flow.description: View valid Use Case Documents in HTML format in the main panel, by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on a use case in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid Use Case Document.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View Use Case Documents in HTML format in the main panel, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid Use Case Document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

step.action: Select “Open in default view” option.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View Use Case Documents in HTML format in the default browser, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported valid Use Case Document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

step.action: Select “Open with default browser” option.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the default browser. [FR_TARGET_0130]

useCase.name: Viewing Invalid Use Case in HTML Format
useCase.description: Viewing Use Case Documents in HTML format when they have some error.

flow.description: View Use Case Documents with duplicated step ID in HTML format in the main panel, by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on a use case with duplicated step ID in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case with duplicated step ID.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. The duplicated steps IDs are highlighted. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View Use Case Documents with invalid step ID reference in HTML format in the main panel, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case with invalid step ID reference in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case with invalid step ID reference.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

step.action: Select “Open in default view” option.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. The invalid step ID reference is highlighted. [FR_TARGET_0130]

flow.description: View Use Case Documents with invalid step ID reference in HTML format in the default browser, by right-clicking the use case.

step.action: Right-click on a use case with invalid step ID reference in the “Use Cases” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported use case with invalid step ID reference.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with two options.

step.action: Select “Open with default browser” option.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the default browser. The invalid step ID reference is highlighted. [FR_TARGET_0130]

useCase.name: Viewing a Generated Test Suite with Microsoft Excel
useCase.description: Viewing Test Suite Documents in TaRGeT with Microsoft Excel.

flow.description: View Test Suite Document by double-clicking.

step.action: Double-click on a test suite document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: The Microsoft Excel is invoked and the document is opened. The Test Cases and Traceability Matrixes appear in the document.[FR_TARGET_0005, FR_TARGET 0243, FR_TARGET 0175, FR_TARGET 0240,]

useCase.name: Renaming a Document
useCase.description: Renaming Use Case or Test Suite Documents in TaRGeT.

flow.description: Rename a test suite document.

step.action: Right-click on a generated test suite document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Rename” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.response: A dialog is popped up with a text field.

step.action: Change the document name to a valid name and click on “OK” button. [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: The document is renamed.

flow.description: Rename a Use Case Document.

step.action: Right-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported Use Case Document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Rename” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.response: A dialog is popped up with a text field.

step.action: Change the document name to a valid name and click on “OK” button. [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: The document is renamed.

flow.description: Select to rename more than one document.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select more than one document and right-click on the selection. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two documents (test suite or Use Case Documents).
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “Rename” option is disabled.

flow.description: Type an invalid document name.

step.action: Try to change the document name to an invalid name (e.g. a name containing “<” or “*” characters). [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that the name is invalid. The “OK” button is disabled.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the main window.

flow.description: Type an invalid document name and retype a valid name.

step.action: Try to change the document name to an invalid name (e.g. a name containing “<” or “*” characters). [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that the name is invalid. The “OK” button is disabled.

step.action: Erase the invalid name and type a valid name.
step.response: The OK button is enabled.

step.action: Click on the OK button
step.response: The document is renamed.

flow.description: Cancel the rename.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the main window.

flow.description: Type a document name that is being used by another use case document.

step.action: Right-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two use cases.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “Rename” option is enabled.

step.action: Click on “Rename” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0001]
step.response: A dialog is popped up with a text field.

step.action: Type a name that is already in use.
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that the name is already in use. The “OK” button is disabled.

flow.description: Type a test suite file name that is being used by another test suite file.

step.action: Right-click on a test case document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two test suites.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “Rename” option is enabled.

flow.description: Type an empty name.

step.action: Type an empty name. [FR_TARGET_0025]
step.response: A message is displayed indicating that the name must not be empty. The “OK” button is disabled.

useCase.name: Deleting a Document
useCase.description: Deleting Use Cases or Test Suite Documents in TaRGeT.

flow.description: Delete a test suite document.

step.action: Right-click on a generated test suite document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one already generated test suite.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Delete” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.response: A dialog is displayed asking a confirmation.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The document(s) is (are) deleted. The project work area is refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: Delete a Use Case Document that is not referred by another document.

step.action: Right-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least one imported Use Case Document. The imported documents do not refer to a use case of another imported document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Delete” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.response: A dialog is displayed asking a confirmation.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The document(s) is(are) deleted. The project work area is refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0015]

flow.description: Delete a Use Case Document that is referred by another document.

step.action: Right-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view. The selected document is referred by a use case of another imported document.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two imported Use Case Documents. A use case is referred by another use case from a different document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Delete” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.response: A dialog is displayed asking a confirmation and informing that the document is being referred by another document.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The document(s) is(are) deleted. The project work area is refreshed. Some invalid reference errors are displayed in “Error” view. [FR_TARGET_0015, FR_TARGET_0120]

flow.description: Delete more than one generated test suite.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select more than one test suite document and right-click on the selection.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two generated test suites.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Delete one test suite and one Use Case Document that is being referenced.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select one test suite document and a Use Case Document, and right-click on the selection.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has at least two imported Use Case Document and at least one generated test suite. The imported Use Case Document is referenced by another imported document.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Click on “Delete” option in the drop down menu. [FR_TARGET_0003]
step.response: A dialog is displayed asking a confirmation and informing that the document is being referred by another document.

step.action: Click on “Yes” button.
step.response: The document(s) is(are) deleted. The project work area is refreshed. Some invalid reference errors are displayed in “Error” view. [FR_TARGET_0015, FR_TARGET_0120]

flow.description: Delete two Use Case Documents.

step.action: In the “Artifacts” view, Select one test suite two Use Case Documents, and right-click on the selection. One of the selected documents refers to the other.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. The project has two imported Use Case Document. One imported Use Case Document is referenced by the other.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

flow.description: Cancel the document deletion.

step.action: Click on “No” button.
step.response: The document(s) is (are) not deleted.

useCase.name: Updating the Use Case Documents outside the TaRGeT UI
useCase.description: Updating Use Case Documents outside TaRGeT UI.

flow.description: Edit a Use Case Document with duplicated step ID outside TaRGeT UI.

step.action: Open an already imported Use Case Document with the Microsoft Word (outside the TaRGeT). The document has a duplicated step ID. [FR_TARGET_0005]
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up and a project is opened. There is at least one imported Use Case Document with duplicated step ID in the project.
step.response: The document is opened in the default viewer outside the TaRGeT.

step.action: Edit the duplicated ID, save the document and close it.
step.response: The document is fixed.

step.action: Go back to the TaRGeT window.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: The fixed duplicated ID error is removed from the “Error” view.

useCase.name: Rejecting a crashed Use Case Documents
useCase.description: Rejecting crashed Use Case Documents.

flow.description: Damage an imported Use Case Document.

step.action: Double-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is one imported and valid Use Case Document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

step.action: Change the document, damaging its structure, and go back to the TaRGeT window.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: A new error is displayed in the “Error” view indicating that the document is damaged. No information related to this document is displayed in the “Use Case” view. An error icon is assigned to the document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0120, FR_TARGET_0125]

useCase.name: Rejecting a Use Case Document With Duplicated Feature ID
useCase.description: Rejecting Use Case Documents that assign to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document.

flow.description: Assign to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document.

step.action: Double-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is two imported and valid Use Case Document.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

step.action: Change the document, by assigning to a feature an ID that is being used by a feature of another document, and go back to the TaRGeT window.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: A new error is displayed in the “Error” view indicating that one of the documents contains a duplicated feature ID. The document is rejected and no information related to the document is displayed in the “Use Case” view. An error icon is assigned to the document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0120, FR_TARGET_0125]

useCase.name: Rejecting a Use Case Document With Duplicated Use Case ID
useCase.description: Rejecting Use Case Documents that assign to a use case an ID that is being used by another use case of the same feature.

flow.description: Assign to a use case an ID that is being used by another use of the same feature.

step.action: Double-click on a Use Case Document in the “Artifacts” view.
step.condition: A project is opened in TaRGeT. There is one imported and valid Use Case Document. The document has at least one feature with more than one use case.
step.response: The Microsoft Word is invoked and the document is opened. [FR_TARGET_0005]

step.action: Change the document, by assigning to a use case an ID that is being used by another use case of the same feature, and go back to the TaRGeT window.
step.response: A progress bar is displayed while the project is being refreshed. [FR_TARGET_0110, FR_TARGET_0015]

step.action: Wait the progress bar.
step.response: A new error is displayed in the “Error” view indicating that one of the documents contains a duplicated use case ID. The document is rejected and no information related to the document is displayed in the “Use Case” view. An error icon is assigned to the document in the “Artifacts” view. [FR_TARGET_0120, FR_TARGET_0125]

useCase.name: Searching in Use Case Document
useCase.description: Searching in Use Case Document.

flow.description: Perform a search when some valid Use Case Documents are already imported.

step.action: Choose “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: TaRGeT is started up. A project is already opened. There is at least one document imported. No error is listed in the “Error” list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. “Search” option is available.

step.action: Choose “Search” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: “Search” window is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0135]

step.action: Type a query in the input area.
step.response: The “Find” field is filled.

step.action: Click on “Search” button.
step.response: The search results are displayed in "Search Results" View. Verify if the results are in accordance to the query.

flow.description: Cancel the search.

step.action: Click on “Cancel” button.
step.response: The focus goes back to the work area.

flow.description: Using the specific field “Use Case Identifier”.

step.action: "Type a query for serching based on use case Id, i.e. "ucid:<use_case_id>". A use case with id <use_case_id> must be contained in the project.
step.response: The “Find” field is filled.

step.action: Click on “Search” button.
step.response: At least one use case is displayed in “Search Results” View. [FR_TARGET_0135]

flow.description: Using the specific field “From Step”.

step.action: Type “from step: START” in the input area.
step.response: The “Find” field is filled.

flow.description: Using shortcut.

step.action: Press CTRL+F
step.response: “Search” window is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0135]

useCase.name: Viewing Search Results
useCase.description: Viewing search results.

flow.description: View found Use Case Documents in HTML format by double-clicking the use case.

step.action: Double-click on a use case in the “Search Results” view.
step.response: The selected Use Case is displayed in HTML format in the main panel. [FR_TARGET_0130]

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites through the On The Fly Generation
useCase.description: Generating Test Cases through the On The Fly Generation.

flow.description: Generate test cases in a spreadsheet format.

step.action: Choose the “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. There is an already created project with at least one imported use case without errors. [FR_TARGET_0100]
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with “Search”, “Preferences” and “On The Fly Generation” options. The “On The Fly Generation” option is available.

step.action: Choose the “On The Fly Generation” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: The “On The Fly Generation Editor” window is displayed. The “Test Selection Page” is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0234]

step.action: Go to “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view and click on the “Save Test Suite” button.
step.condition: No filter is selected. [FR_TARGET_0150]
step.response: The “Test Cases Generation Summary” pop up is displayed informing the number of generated test cases and the total time required to complete the process. [FR_TARGET_0160]

step.action: Click on the “ok” button.
step.response: The test suite is generated with the default name and the correct structure. The new test suite is in the “Artifacts” view in the TestCases folder. Notice that the generated test cases are according to the test cases list of the “Test Cases viewer” tab. [FR_TARGET_0237, FR_TARGET_0239, FR_TARGET_0170]

flow.description: Generating tests through a document with errors.

step.action: Choose the “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up. A project is opened and some Use Case Documentation is already imported. There is at least one error in the “Error” list.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. The “On The Fly Generation” option is available.

step.action: Choose the “On The Fly Generation” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: A dialog is displayed indicating that there is/are error(s) in the project and it is not possible to generate tests. [FR_TARGET_0239]

step.action: Click on “Ok” button.
step.response: The focus comes back to the work area.

flow.description: Generating tests using a template.

step.action: Go to “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view and click on the “Save Test Suite” button.
step.condition: No filter is selected. [FR_TARGET_0150]
step.response: The “Import Template” pop up is displayed asking you if you want to import a spreadsheet template to generate the test suit based on it.

step.action: Press “Yes” button.
step.response: A “Browse File” window is showed to select the .xls file.

step.action: Choose a .xls template.
step.condition: There is available a spreadsheet template exported from Test Central.
step.response: The “Test Cases Generation Summary” pop up is displayed informing the number of generated test cases and the total time required to complete the process.

flow.description: Generating tests without a template.

step.action: Press “No” button.
step.response: A “Browse File” window is showed to select the .xls file.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites using Requirement Filter
useCase.description: Selecting test cases by Requirement Filter.

flow.description: Filtering test suit generation by requirements.

step.action: In “Selection” tab in “On The Fly Generation Editor”, select some requirements (not all) in the Requirements Selection area.
step.condition: The imported use cases refer to more than one requirement.
step.response: Some requirements are selected. [FR_TARGET_0145]

step.action: Go to “Test Cases Viewer” tab.
step.response: Verify that test cases in the “Generated Test Cases” list are according to the selected filter. [FR_TARGET_0236, FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: All requirements are selected.

step.action: In the tab “Selection” in the “On The Fly Generation Editor”, click on “Select all” button in the page of Requirements.
step.condition: The imported use cases have one or more than one step which refers to distinct requirements
step.response: All requirements are selected. [FR_TARGET_0145]

flow.description: Deselect all requirements selection.

step.action: In the tab “Selection” in the “On The Fly Generation Editor”, click on “Deselect all” button in the page of Requirements.
step.response: All requirements are deselected. [FR_TARGET_0145]

flow.description: There is no reference to any requirement in the imported use cases document(s).

step.action: Choose “Tools” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: No requirement is referenced in the imported use cases document(s).
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. “On The Fly Generation” option is available.

step.action: Choose “On The Fly Generation” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: The “On The Fly Generation Editor” window is displayed. The “Requirements List” is disabled. The “Select All” and “Deselect All” buttons are disabled. [FR_TARGET_0145]

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites using Use Cases Filter
useCase.description: Selecting test cases by Use Cases Filter.

flow.description: Filtering test suit generation by use cases.

step.action: In the tab “Selection” in the “On The Fly Generation Editor”, select one or more (press CTRL) Use Cases available in the document.
step.condition: The imported use cases document have at least use case.
step.response: The use cases are selected.

step.action: Click on “Add Use case” button.
step.response: One or more Use cases are added in the “Selected Use Cases” area. [FR_TARGET_0153]

flow.description: Remove Use Cases from filter.

step.action: In the tab “Selection” in the “On The Fly Generation Editor”, select some use cases on the “Selected Use Cases” area.
step.response: The use cases are selected.

step.action: Click on the “Remove Use Case” button.
step.response: The selected use cases were removed from “Selected Use Cases” area. [FR_TARGET_0153]

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites with Test Purposes
useCase.description: Selecting test cases by Test Purposes Filter.

flow.description: Filtering a test suite generation by a test purpose

step.action: Go to “Test Purpose Creation” and select *-* step in the “Steps” area and click on “Select” button.
step.response: A “*” symbol is added to “Current Test Purpose” field.

step.action: In the “Steps” area, select a step and click on “Select” button.
step.response: A reference to this step is added to the “Current Test Purpose” field. [FR_TARGET_0151]

step.action: In the “Steps” area, select *-* step and click on “Select” button.
step.response: A “*” symbol is added to “Current Test Purpose” field.

step.action: Click on “OK” button.
step.response: The test purpose is added to the “Created Test Purposes” list. The “Current Test Purpose” list is empty.

flow.description: Move the step to lower level.

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” -> “Selection” tab -> “Test Purpose Creation” and in “Steps” area, select a step and click on “Select” button.
step.response: A reference to this step is added to the “Current Test Purpose” field. [FR_TARGET_0151]

step.action: Go to “Test Purpose Creation” and select *-* step in the “Steps” area and click on “Select” button.
step.response: A “*” symbol is added to “Current Test Purpose” field.

step.action: Select the first step in the “Current Test Purpose” field and click in the “Down” button.
step.response: The selected test is in a lower level.

flow.description: Move the step to upper level.

step.action: Select the last step in the “Current Test Purpose” field and click in the “Up” button.
step.response: The selected test is in upper level.

flow.description: Clear one or more step(s) from “Current Test Purpose” field.

step.action: Select one or more steps on “Current Test Purpose” area and click on “Clean” button.
step.response: The selected step(s) was(were) removed from “Current Test Purpose” field.

flow.description: Remove a test purpose from the “Created Test Purposes” list.

step.action: Select a test purpose on “Created Test Purposes” list.
step.response: The test purpose is highlighted. [FR_TARGET_0151]

step.action: Click on “Clean” button on “Created Test Purposes” area.
step.response: The test purpose was removed from the “Created Test Purposes” list.

flow.description: Remove all test purposes from the created test purposes list.

step.action: Click on “Clear All” button on “Created Test Purposes” area.
step.condition: There is more than one test purpose on “Test purposes” list.
step.response: The “Created Test Purposes” list is empty. [FR_TARGET_0151]

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites with Path Coverage
useCase.description: Selecting test cases from Path Coverage.

flow.description: Path coverage percentage is 50%.

step.action: Go to “Path Coverage” area and set to 50.
step.response: “Path Coverage” is 50%. [FR_TARGET_0152]

useCase.name: Visualizing Test Cases in Test Cases Viewer
useCase.description: Visualize the test cases before the test suite generation.

flow.description: Visualizing Test Cases.

step.action: Go to the “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view.
step.condition: No filter is selected.
step.response: The “Common Test Cases” and the “New Test Cases” boxes are checked. [FR_TARGET_0235]

step.action: Verify the test cases in the “Generated Test Cases” list
step.response: All test cases appear in the “Generated Test Cases” list.

flow.description: Visualizing the “Common Test Cases”.

step.action: Filter the test suite selecting some requirements in the “Selection” tab.
step.response: The filter(s) are selected. [FR_TARGET_0234]

step.action: Go to the “Test Cases” tab in “On The Fly Generation Editor” view.
step.response: The “Common Test Cases” and the “New Test Cases” boxes are checked. [FR_TARGET_0235]

step.action: Deselect the “New Test Cases” box.
step.response: Just the “Common Test Cases” selected by the filters in the Selected tab appear in the “Generated Test Cases” list with black font. [FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Visualizing the “Removed Test Cases” and the “Common Test Cases”.

step.action: Select the “Removed Test Cases” box.
step.response: The removed test cases are added to the “Generated Test Cases” list with a red font.

flow.description: Visualizing the “Removed Test Cases”.

step.action: Deselect “Common Test Cases” box.
step.response: Just the test cases removed by the filters appear in the “Generated Test Cases” list with a red font.

flow.description: Visualizing the lists of “Common Test Cases” and “New test Cases” after saving a filter.

step.action: Select a filter configuration saved previously.
step.response: The filter configuration is selected.

step.action: Go to “Selection” tab and select some requirements that are equal to saved filter and some requirements different from saved filter.
step.response: The filter(s) are selected. [FR_TARGET_0234]

step.action: Go to the “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view.
step.response: The “Common Test Cases” and “New Test Cases” boxes are checked. [FR_TARGET_0235]

step.action: Go to “Generated Test Cases” list.
step.response: The common test cases between the first selected filter and the second selected filter that is loaded in the “Selection” tab, appear with black font in the “Generated Test Cases” list. The New Test Cases appear with green font in the “Generated Test Cases” list.

flow.description: Visualizing the “Removed Test Cases” after saving a filter

step.action: Click on the “Load Former Filter Selection” button.
step.response: The new filter configuration is loaded and the correspondent test cases appear in the “Generated Test Cases “list. [FR_TARGET_0237, FR_TARGET_0236]

step.action: Select the default filter configuration “All test Cases”.
step.response: The filter configuration is selected. The common test cases between the selected filter and the filter that is loaded in the “Selection” tab appear with black font in the “Generated Test Cases” list.

step.action: Select the “Removed Test Cases” box.
step.response: The removed test cases appear in the “Generated Test Cases” list with a red font.

flow.description: Deselecting Common Test Cases box.

step.action: Deselect the “Common Test Cases” box.
step.response: No test cases appear in the “Generated Test Cases” list.

useCase.name: Saving a filter configuration in the Test Cases Viewer
useCase.description: Saving and loading a filter configuration in the test cases viewer.

flow.description: Saving a filter configuration.

step.action: Click on the “Save Current Filter Selection” button.
step.response: The new filter configuration is saved and appears in the common list. [FR_TARGET_0236]

flow.description: Loading a saved filter configuration.

step.action: Select a filter configuration saved previously.
step.response: The filter configuration is selected.

step.action: Click on the “Load Former Filter Selection” button.
step.response: The new filter configuration is loaded and the correspondent test cases appear in the “Generated Test Cases “list. [FR_TARGET_0237, FR_TARGET_0236]

flow.description: Loading the default filter configuration.

step.action: Select the default filter configuration “All test Cases”.
step.response: The filter configuration is selected.

step.action: Click on the “Load Former Filter Selection” button.
step.response: All test cases appear in the “Generated test cases” list.

useCase.name: Visualizing Test Cases in table format in Test Cases Viewer
useCase.description: Visualizing test cases in spreadsheet format.

flow.description: View a test case in the table.

step.action: Click on any test case in the “Generated Test Cases” list.
step.response: The chosen test case appears in the “Selected test Cases” view in the spreadsheet template. [FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Select more than one test case to view in the table format.

step.action: Click on more than one (using CTRL) test case in the “Generated Test Cases” list.
step.response: The first test case selected in crescent order that appears on list is shown in the “Selected test Cases” view in the spreadsheet standard. [FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Deselect a test case.

step.action: Deselect the first test case selected (using CTRL) in the “Generated Test Cases” list.
step.response: The spreadsheet view is updated, displaying another selected test case that appears first in he list in the “Generated test Cases” list.

step.action: Deselect the “New Test Cases” box.

step.action: Select the “Removed Test Cases” box.

flow.description: Visualizing the list of “Common Test Cases” and “New test Cases” after saving a filter.

step.action: Click on the “Save Current Filter Selection”.
step.response: The new filter configuration is saved and appears in the common list. [FR_TARGET_0236]

step.action: Click on the “Load Former Filter Selection” button.

useCase.name: Saving a filter configuration in the Traceability Matrixes

step.action: Click on the “Save Current Filter Selection”.

flow.description: Loading a saved filter configuration in the traceability matrixes.

step.action: Click on the “Load Former Filter Selection” button.

useCase.name: Visualizing Test Cases in table format in the Traceability Matrixes

step.action: Click in any test case in the matrixes list.

useCase.name: Including Test Cases Permanently in test suite
useCase.description: Including test cases permanently in the test suit, independently of filters selection.

flow.description: Include permanently a test case that is already included by the filter selection.

step.action: Go to the “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view.
step.condition: Any filter has to be selected. [FR_TARGET_0234]
step.response: The selected test cases by filter are displayed in the “Generated Test Cases” list. [FR_TARGET_0237]

step.action: Check the “Removed Test Cases” box.
step.response: The removed test cases by filter are displayed in the “Generated Test Cases” list with a red font.

step.action: Click with the right mouse button in a included test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Include Test Case Permanently” options are available and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Include Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case appears “Included Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab and remains with a black font in the “Generated Test Case” list. [FR_TARGET_0241]

flow.description: Cancel the test case inclusion permanently.

step.action: Go back to the test case tab and click with the mouse right button in this included test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” options are available and “Include Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Included Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

flow.description: Exclude the test case included permanently.

step.action: Go back to the test case tab and click with the mouse right button in this included test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” options are available and “Include Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Exclude Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Included Test Cases” list, is added to “Excluded Test Cases” list in the Inclusion/Exclusion tab and shown with a red font in the “Generated Test Cases list” in the Test Cases tab.

flow.description: Cancel the test case inclusion permanently in the Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

step.action: Go to the Inclusion/Exclusion tab and click with the mouse right button in this included test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” options are available.

step.action: Select “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Included Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

flow.description: Include a test case that is excluded by the filter selection.

step.action: Click with the mouse right button in a excluded test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Include Test Case Permanently” options are available and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable. [FR_TARGET_0241]

step.action: Select “Include Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case appears in the “Included Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab and is shown with a black font in the “Generated Test Case” list.

useCase.name: Excluding Test Cases Permanently in test suite
useCase.description: Excluding test cases permanently in the test suit, independently of filters selection.

flow.description: Exclude permanently a test case that is already excluded by the filter selection.

step.action: Go to the “Test Cases” tab in the “On The Fly Generation Editor” view.
step.condition: Any filter has to be selected. [FR_TARGET_0234]
step.response: The selected test cases by filter are displayed in the “Generated Test Cases” list. [FR_TARGET_0237]

step.action: Check the “Removed Test Cases” box.
step.response: The removed test cases by filter are displayed in the “Generated Test Cases” list with a red font.

step.action: Click with the mouse right button in a excluded test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Include Test Case Permanently” options are available and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Exclude Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case appears “Excluded Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab and remains with a red font in the “Generated Test Case” list. [FR_TARGET_0241]

flow.description: Cancel the test case exclusion permanently.

step.action: Go back to the test case tab and click with the mouse right button in this excluded test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Include Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” options are available and “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Excluded Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

flow.description: Exclude the test case included permanently.

step.action: Go back to the test case tab and click with the mouse right button in this excluded test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Include Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” options are available and “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Include Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Excluded Test Cases” list, is added to “Included Test Cases” list in the Inclusion/Exclusion tab and shown with a black font in the “Generated Test Cases list” in the Test Cases tab.

flow.description: Cancel the test case exclusion permanently in the Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

step.action: Go to the Inclusion/Exclusion tab and click with the mouse right button in this excluded test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Include Test Case Permanently” and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” options are available.

step.action: Select “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” option.
step.response: The test case is removed from “Included Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab.

flow.description: Exclude a test case that is included by the filter selection.

step.action: Click with the mouse right button in a included test case.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with the “Exclude Test Case Permanently” and “Include Test Case Permanently” options are available and “Cancel Test Case Exclusion” and “Cancel Test Case Inclusion” are unavailable.

step.action: Select “Exclude Test Case Permanently” option.
step.response: The test case appears in the “Excluded Test Cases” list of Inclusion/Exclusion tab and is shown with a red font in the “Generated Test Case” list.

useCase.name: Generating Test Suites Changing Test Case Field Parameters
useCase.description: Configuring test case fields.

flow.description: Configuring test cases parameters.

step.action: Go to “Tools” in the menu bar.
step.condition: There is an already created project with at least one imported use case without errors. [FR_TARGET_0100]
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed with “Search”, “Preferences” and “On The Fly Generation” options. The “Preferences” option is available.

step.action: Select “Preferences” option.
step.response: The Preferences wizard is displayed with “Test Case ID”, “Test Case Initial ID”, “Empty Field”, “Objective Prefix”, “Print Use Case Description”, “Print Flow Description” and “Keep Requirements” fields.

flow.description: Cancel the preferences.

step.action: Press “Cancel” button.
step.response: The field was not changed, the preferences screen is closed and the focus goes back to the main window. [FR_TARGET_0231]

flow.description: Changing “Objective Prefix” field.

step.action: Type a wanted prefix in the “Objective prefix” field and press OK button.
step.condition: The “Print Flow Description” field in the Preferences window cannot be “None”
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0231]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: All test cases contain their objective field with the prefix defined by the user. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Empty Field” parameter.

step.action: Type a wanted content in the “Empty Field” field and press OK button.
step.condition: The “Print Flow Description” and “Print Use case description” fields is configured to “None”
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0231]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: In all test cases, the fields that are empty in the Use Case Document are filled with this content defined by the user. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Test Case Id” parameter to a fixed value.

step.action: Type “<tc_featureid>_TESTE_<tc_id>” in the “Test Case Id” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0231]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: All Test Case Id fields are filled according the standard defined by the user. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Test Case initial Id” parameter

step.action: Type an initial test case id (number) in the “Test Case Initial Id” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0231]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: All Test Case Ids are filled according the test case initial id (crescent order) defined by the user. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Print Use Case Description” parameter to “All”.

step.action: Choose the “ALL” option in the “Print Use Case Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: All descriptions of all Use cases related to the test case are concatenated in the Case Description field for each test case. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Print Use Case Description” parameter to “Last”.

step.action: Choose the “Last” option in the “Print Use Case Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: Just the description of last Use case related to each test case is shown in the Case Description field. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Print Use Case Description” parameter to “None”.

step.action: Choose the “None” option in the “Print Use Case Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: The Case Description field does not contain any description and it is filled with “Empty Field” suggested in Preferences window. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237, FR_TARGET_231]

flow.description: Changing “Print Flow Description” parameter to “All”.

step.action: Choose the “ALL” option in the “Print Flow Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: All descriptions of all Flows related to each test case are concatenated after “Objective Prefix” in the respective field. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Print Flow Description” parameter to “Last”.

step.action: Choose the “Last” option in the “Print Flow Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: Just description of last Flow related to each test case is shown after “Objective Prefix” in the respective field. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237]

flow.description: Changing “Print Flow Description” parameter to “None”.

step.action: Choose the “None” option in the “Print Flow Description” field and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed. [FR_TARGET_0232]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: The Flow Description field does not contain any description and it is filled with “Empty Field” suggested in Preferences window. [FR_TARGET_0235, ,FR_TARGET_0237, FR_TARGET_231]

flow.description: Check “Keep Requirements” parameter.

step.action: Check the “Keep Requirement” option and press OK button.
step.response: The preferences configuration is changed.[FR_TARGET_0233]

step.action: Go to “On The Fly Generation” and select each test case from the list.
step.response: The requirements are shown into each step that is associated, besides to be shown at Requirements list. [FR_TARGET_0160, FR_TARGET_0170, ,FR_TARGET_0175]

useCase.name: Starting Consistency Management
useCase.description: Starting Consistency Management Editor.

flow.description: Starting Consistency Management Editor.

step.action: Go to “Test Cases” tab and mark the option “Start Consistency Managememnt before saving.”
step.condition: The On The Fly Editor is Opened.
step.response: A window is displayed asking the user to select a generated test suite to compare. [FR_TARGET_245].

step.action: Select a test suite and press the “Finish” button.
step.response: The Consistency Management Editor is showed and the system displays one table containing the new test cases generated by the On The Fly and another table containing the percentage of similarity with the test cases of the previous selected test suite. [FR_TARGET_244]The system automatically associates a new test case to an old one that has a similarity level of 100%. [FR_TARGET_246]

flow.description: No test suites available.

step.action: Go to “Test Cases” tab and mark the option “Start Consistency Managememnt before saving.”
step.condition: The On The Fly Editor is Opened. There is no test suite in the project folder.
step.response: A window is displayed asking the user to select a test suite to compare, but none test suite is displayed in the list and a message is shown informing that there is no test suites available. The “Finish” button is disabled.

step.action: Press the “Cancel” button.
step.response: The window is closed and the On The Fly Editor is displayed.

useCase.name: Associating Test Cases
useCase.description: Associating similar test cases in the Consistency Management Editor.

flow.description: Associating similar test cases in the Consistency Management Editor.

step.action: Select one test case from the new test cases table.
step.condition: There are no modifications between the new and the old test suites.
step.response: The system shows in the old test cases table the similarity percentage between the selected new test case and the old ones. The “Delete” and “New Id” options are also displayed.

step.action: Select one test case from the old test case table.
step.response: The system displays two spreadsheets showing the fields of the selected test cases in the “Compare Test Cases” area. The system marks with blue color the different fields and with yellow color the extra steps.

step.action: Press the “Save Test Suite” button.
step.response: The system displays a message informing that the test cases were merged and a new test suite has been generated.

flow.description: A new test case has been created.

step.action: Select one test case from the New Test Cases table.
step.condition: There is at least one modification between the new test suite and the old test suite.
step.response: The system marks the new or modified test case with red color. The system shows in the old test cases table the similarity levels between the selected new test case and the old ones different from 100%. The “Delete” and “New Id” options are also displayed and the “New Id” option is checked.

step.action: Press “Save Test Suite” button.
step.response: The system displays a message informing that the test cases were merged and a new test suite has been generated. The generated test suite must contain the new test case and the new id that has been attributed to it.

flow.description: Removing a test case.

step.action: Check the “Delete” option in the old test case table and press the “Save Test Suite” button.
step.response: The system informs that the selected test case will be removed from the test suite and asks if the user wants to proceed.

step.action: Press the “OK” button.
step.response: The system displays a message informing that the test cases were merged and a new test suite has been generated. The generated test suite must not contain the deleted test case.

flow.description: Associate two new test cases to the same old test case

step.action: Associate two test cases from “New Test Cases” table to the same test case in the “Old Test Case” table.
step.response: The system shows a warning message informing that there is another test case already associated with the selected old one.

step.action: Press the “OK” button and press the “Save Test Suite” option.
step.response: The system displays a message informing that the test cases were merged and a new test suite has been generated. The generated test suite must contain two test cases with the same id.

useCase.name: Setting up Next New Id
useCase.description: Configure the next new id to new test case.

flow.description: Associating similar test cases in the Consistency Management Editor.

step.action: In the “Preferences” area, press the “Change” button.
step.response: The system enables the “Next New Id” field for edition.

step.action: Fill the “Next New Id” field with a desired value and presses the “Save” button.
step.response: The system disables the “Next New Id” field for edition and save the new filled value.

step.action: Press the “Save Test Suite” option.
step.response: The system displays a message informing that the test cases were merged and a new test suite has been generated. The generated test suite must contain the test case marked as new with the configured id.

useCase.name: Changing compared Test Suite
useCase.description: Change the test suite file that is being compared to the New test Suite generated by On The Fly.

flow.description: Changing Test Suite file.

step.action: Above Old Test Cases table, press the “Change” button.
step.condition: There are one more generated test suites different from suite generated by On the Fly (New Test suite).
step.response: The system shows a window with all saved test suites and ask to user select a test suite to compare.

step.action: Choose a test suite different from current.
step.response: The system shows a progress bar indicating the test suite loading process and opens another Consistency Management window comparing the selected Test suite file.

useCase.name: Automatic Association configuration
useCase.description: Configuring Automatic Association.

flow.description: Changing Test Suite file.

step.action: In Automatic Association area, fill the “First most similar” with a value a little less than the similarity percentage of first test case most similar to new test case.
step.condition: There is a new modified test that has one test much similar with it (similarity percentage value is high) and the others are very different from it (similarity percentage value is lower than the first most similar).
step.response: The First Most Similar percentage is changed.

step.action: In Automatic Association area, fill the “Second most similar” with a value a higher than the similarity percentage of second test case most similar to new test case.
step.response: The Second Most Similar percentage is changed.

step.action: Press “Refresh” button
step.response: The first most similar test case is automatically checked in the Old Test Cases table.

useCase.name: Viewing the About Window
useCase.description: Displaying the About Window.

flow.description: Access the about window.

step.action: Choose “Help” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0205]

step.action: Choose “About TaRGeT” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: “About” window is displayed. The content of the windows is detailed in TaRGeT requirements document. [FR_TARGET_0210]

useCase.name: Viewing the Help Window
useCase.description: Displaying the Help Window.

flow.description: Access the help window.

step.action: Choose “Help” option in the menu bar.
step.condition: The TaRGeT is already started up.
step.response: A drop down menu is displayed.

step.action: Choose “Help Contents” option in the drop down menu.
step.response: “Help” window is displayed. [FR_TARGET_0205]
